page.title: 04GREAT AMWELL-HISTORIC HOUSES
page.content: {SQUARE 3712 {HOUSING}: Much of interest: George IV Public House (formerly the 'Old Quart Pot') built late C18th.;{CHURCH}of St.John the Baptist, apse Norman, pulpit Jacobean, part of gallery late C19th.; the Old Vicarage, restored in the last five years, built turn of the last century; the{VICARAGE}built 1893; Amwell Grove built by Robert Mylne c.1820, notable because of a chimney in each corner with a large stack centrally placed; the gardens of Well House contain{Aemma's Well}(from which the name of Amwell derives) and which is listed in the original Domesday Book; Flint House & Great Amwell House are also C19th, the latter split up in the last 25 years.
